text:
<@UDP5WL2RX> after going through a few of my existing files and converting it from Pandoc Markdown to Franklin Markdown by hand, I'm realizing that it might be easier if I use a `hfun_pandocify` type function to read the current file's markdown convert it to html, and insert it into the current page. However, when I do this, naturally, the original markdown content also exists below the content I've hfun inserted.

Any recommendations for dealing with this?

elements.text: after going through a few of my existing files and converting it from Pandoc Markdown to Franklin Markdown by hand, I'm realizing that it might be easier if I use a

type function to read the current file's markdown convert it to html, and insert it into the current page. However, when I do this, naturally, the original markdown content also exists below the content I've hfun inserted.

Any recommendations for dealing with this?

text: I think you'd be better off doing this outside of Franklin with a script that converts your original pages into something that Franklin can consume

elements.text: I think you'd be better off doing this outside of Franklin with a script that converts your original pages into something that Franklin can consume

text: Hmm. That makes sense. Thanks for the answer.

elements.text: Hmm. That makes sense. Thanks for the answer.
